sentences: Dora Draganova (Bulgarian: Дора Драганова) (born 29 January 1946) is a Bulgarian composer.
Dora Draganova was born in Sofia, Bulgaria, the daughter of composer Illya Draganov.
After graduating in 1972, she taught piano at the Lyubomir Pipkov National Music High School and harmony at the National Dance Art High School (formerly the State Choreographic High School).
She edited the choral literature magazine Native Song from 1971 to 1991.
She won the first prize in Dobrich in 1999 for the musical play Pippi Long-Stocking after Astrid Lindgren.
Book of the Specks for violin, viola, piano and reader (1994) *Souvenir from Morocco for violin, guitar and piano (1998)
